alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 8:51AM CDT until June 03 at 4:27AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Missouri, including the following counties, Miller and Morgan. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Gravois Creek at Leatherman Lane, Richland Creek at Blue Bird Road, Gabriel Creek at Highway BB, Blue Springs Creek at Highway Z and Rocky Ford Creek at Ritchey Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eldon, Versailles, Village of Four Seasons, Lake Ozark, Stover, Laurie, Barnett and Syracuse. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
